properties.name: Chelidonia

properties.name: Arsada

properties.name: Solyma?

properties.name: Samos
properties.statusref: existent as city in Late Republican times (Broughton 1938, p. 700); Strabo XIV.1.3; 1.14; civitas libera (Pliny NH V.135 notes the entire island as free; Broughton 1938, p. 706; Cassius Dio LIV, 9); possibly lost status of civitas libera under Vespasian

properties.name: Rhosos
properties.statusref: Broughton 1938, p. 702; Strabo XIV.5.19 names Rhosos as city (polis)

properties.name: Alexandria ad Issum
properties.statusref: Broughton 1938, p. 702; Pliny NH V.91 calls this an oppidum; Strabo XIV.5.19 mentions Alexandria as polis

properties.name: Zeugma
properties.statusref: Strabo XIV.2.29 mentions this place, city, outside research area

properties.name: Doliche
properties.statusref: part of the quattor civitas Commagenorum, together with Samosata, Perrhe and Germanikeia (Schütte-Maischatz 2004, p. 72); RPC online records types, dating to Marcus Aurelius and Commodus

properties.name: Germanikeia
properties.statusref: RPC Online records types, dating from Marcus Aurelius to Commodus

properties.name: Samosata
properties.statusref: Pliny V.85 calls Samosata the capital of Commagene; Strabo XIV.2.29; XVI.2.3 notes Samosata as a polis; RPC Online records types, dating Antoninus to Marcus Aurelius

properties.name: Elaious
properties.statusref: listed as polis by Hansen & Nielsen 2004, p. 1303; RPC Online records types, dating Commodus

properties.name: Koila
properties.statusref: Broughton 1938, p. 734 based on numismatics (Head 1911, p. 259); Pliny NH IV.49 as portus; CIL III 7380 dated c. 55 suggests it was an official city (which IGR I.822-3 confirm for the latter half of the first c AD) and suggest it became a procuratorseat

properties.name: Sestos
properties.statusref: Strabo XIII.1.2; 1.6;1.22 mentions the city and calls it the best in the Chersonesus; Pliny NH IV.49 as urbs; RPC Online records types dating Trajan and Hadrian

properties.name: Callipolis
properties.statusref: Strabo XIII.1.17 polichnion; IGR I.815; 816; 819; RE Kallipo(u)lis 4; Pliny NH IV.49 as urbs

properties.name: Aphrodisias/Col. Flaviopolis
properties.statusref: place existed near the neck of the Chersonese at the beginning of the 2nd c AD, possessing Roman Rights, called Aphrodisias or officially Colonia Flaviopolis, which was an oppidum earlier according to Pliny (as Caela; Jones 1971, p. 17; Pliny IV.47 as co

properties.name: Ainos
properties.statusref: old Aeolic foundation (Jones 1971, p. 2); Strabo VII.6.1 probably as polis and in VII fragment 52 as polis; Pliny NH IV.11 notes it is a free city (oppidum liberum)

properties.name: Traianoupolis
properties.statusref: refounded as a city by Trajan on the earlier town of Doriskos (Jones 1971, p. 18; McAllister 1976, Traianopolis, PECS; Soustal 1991, p. 482; Itin. Ant. 175, 322, 332, 333)

properties.name: Aproi/Col. Claudia Aprensis/Nova Theodosiopolis
properties.statusref: old town which became a Roman Colonia under Claudius; Jones 1971, pp. 17-18; Pliny IV.47 as Colonia; CIL III 386; Itin. Ant. 175, 332, 333; RE Coloniae, p. 550;

properties.name: Perinthos/Heraclea
properties.statusref: Polis in Classical times (Hansen & Nielsen 2004, p. 1303); Pliny NH IV.47 notes Perinthus as oppidum; later renamed during Diocletian as Heraclea (Jones 1971, pp. 14-15, 20, 24-25)

properties.name: Sely(m)bria/Eudoxiopolis
properties.statusref: Polis in Classical times (Herodotus 6.33; Hansen & Nielsen 2004, p. 1303); Jones 1971, p. 512; Pliny NH IV.47 notes Selymbria as oppidum and Strabo VII.6.1 as polis;

properties.name: Plotino(u)polis
properties.statusref: refounded as a city by Trajan (Jones 1971, p. 18; Soustal 1991, p. 240); Itin. Ant. 175,322; Tabula Peutingeriana VIII.34

properties.name: Bizye
properties.statusref: native city refounded by Trajan (Jones 1971, p. 18 & p. 380 n. 24; RE Bizye; Strabo VII fragment 47 notes it as royal residence of the Astai)

properties.name: Adrianoupolis
properties.statusref: founded as a city by Hadrian (Jones 1971, p. 18; IGR I.772)
